description.p: A fast, flurent, light weight music player written in GTK4.

ul.li: Supports most music file types, samba or any other GIO supported remote protocols.
Fast loading music files and parsing tags.
Low memory / storage costs, no thumbnail caches.
Gaussian blurred album cover as window background, follow GNOME 42 light/dark mode.
Album cover with original resolution, can be exported.
Flurent transition animations when switching songs and toogling play/pause.
Show dynamic audio peak when playing.

description.p: It is written in Vala, simple and clean code, with few third-party dependencies:

li.p: Install gtk4, libadwaita, gstreamer develop packages.
Run in the project directory: meson setup build & meson install -C build

description.p: I was inspired by Amberol when I started to learn program with GTK4, I found it is so convenient to write code in Vala language: handle signal with closure, async tasks, easy to compile with C code, similar with programming in Kotlin on Android.
